forest: A woodland town where paths hide beneath ancient canopies.
Trade in timber and herbs thrives by the forest’s edge.
Whispering crowns shelter homes from wind and storm.
Rangers’ outpost — the deep woods are guarded day and night.
A fair of potions and curios draws herbalists from nearby hamlets.
plains: A crossroads of trade — caravans flow year-round.
Granary of the realm: barns brim with grain and flour.
Open skies and steady winds keep the sun shining often.
Renowned craft: weavers, tanners and potters famed across the valley.
Good roads and inns make it the perfect stop for travelers.
mountains: A fortress on the slope: stone walls withstood many sieges.
Mines and smelters feed entire quarters of workers.
Harsh mountain trails welcome only the stubborn and brave.
Taverns at the foothills brim with tales and songs of summits.
Citizens pride themselves on iron will and master smiths.
desert: An oasis in the sands — palms and water gift life to travelers.
The caravanserai hosts merchants from distant lands.
Days scorch and nights freeze — the city beats to the desert’s rhythm.
Charms against sandstorms and tokens of luck are prized here.
A market of spices and incense famed across the region.
tundra: Frozen soil and hardy folk — the hearth’s warmth is treasured.
Fishers and hunters keep the town well-provisioned.
Auroras paint the night sky above the roofs.
A harsh land where a neighbor’s aid outweighs gold.
Stores of furs and fat — staples of trade and survival.
